channel.title: Read Rust - DevOps and Deployment
channel.description: DevOps and Deployment posts on Read Rust

item.title: Rust with Rocket + Elm running on Heroku
item.description: I had this goal of making a web app that was very fast, stable and easy to deploy. This is what I was hoping to accomplish: strongly typed server-side and client-side languages (Rust & Elm respectively), push-button deployments to the cloud with free hosting initially, and sub-second response times for API calls and page loads. With this setup, I think I'm well on my way to accomplishing each of these.
item.dc:creator: Ethan Frei

item.title: Even faster rust builds in Gitlab CI
item.description: tl;dr - I applied a few patterns Iâ€™ve used on other projects to a Gitlab CI-powered rust project to achieve <2min builds. Basically just caching at different layers â€“ caching via the docker image builder pattern at the docker level, aggressive caching with Gitlab CI at the CI runner level, also one more step of combining some build steps (probably unnecessarily).
item.dc:creator: Vados

item.title: Setting up gitlab-ci for Rust
item.description: We're going to create a multi-stage pipeline based on the one I'm using at work, featuring: a build image, linting, test & release builds, and docker containers
item.dc:creator: Alexander Polakov

item.title: Building and Deploying Rust with VSTS
item.description: Since I started at Microsoft about 6 months ago, I had to catch up on their (our) tech: Azure, .NET, Visual Studio. Yet as an avid GitHub user I overlooked one thing completely: Visual Studio Team Services! Turns out itâ€™s quite the hidden gem and after a colleague showed me some of its power, I had to look into it more deeply. Turns out itâ€™s an easy and free resource for any project. Can it help your project? Yes! How? Find out below ðŸ˜Š
item.dc:creator: Claus

item.title: Docker Multi-Stage Build
item.description: On June 13, 2017 took place the Paris Container Day. They unveiled a new docker feature: multi-stage build. That's the subject of this article.
item.dc:creator: Jones Magloire
